document.docTitle: Aulobia cardueli Skoracki, Hendricks and Spicer 2010
document.masterDocTitle: Quill mites (Acari: Syringophilidae) of the Palaearctic region 2840

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Quill mites (Acari: Syringophilidae) of the Palaearctic region 2840

taxonomicName.emphasis: Aulobia cardueli Skoracki, Hendricks and Spicer 2010

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Aulobia cardueli
Skoracki et al. , 2010a: 36
, figs. 14–23.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type host:
Carduelis psaltria (Say)
( Passeriformes : Fringillidae ). Type locality: USA . FEMALE ( holotype and 5 paratypes ). Total body length 815–855.
Gnathosoma
. Infracapitulum densely punctate. Each medial branch of peritremes with 3–4 chambers, each lateral branch with 18–20 chambers. Stylophore apunctate, 180 long. Movable cheliceral digit 130 long.
Idiosoma
. Propodonotal shield concave on anterior margin, punctate near bases of setae ve and si . Length ratio of setae vi:ve:si 1:1.3–1.5:1.7–2. Hysteronotal shield not fused to pygidial shield, apunctate. Pygidial shield, large and punctate posteriorly, bearing terminal setae. Length ratio of setae f2:f1 2.5–3.2:1; ag3 : f2 1:2; ag1 : ag2 1:1; ag2 : g 1:1. Coxal fields I–IV punctate. Setae 3c twice as long as 3b . Legs . Fan-like setae p’ and p” with 7–8 tines. Setae tc’III–IV and tc”III–IV subequal in length. Lengths of setae : vi 30–40, ve 40–60, si 50–75, se 205–225, c1 215–245, c2 210–235, d1 160–190, d2 160–185, e2 140–170, f1 60–85, f2 190–210, h1 60–90, h2 295–325, ps1 and ps2 25–30, g1 and g2 55–60, ag1 70–75, ag2 75–80, ag3 100–115, 3b 35–40, 3c 70–80, tc’III–IV 50–55, tc”III–IV 50–55.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 72.
Aulobia cardueli Skoracki et al.
, female. A , dorsal view; B , ventral view.

FIGURE 73.
Aulobia cardueli Skoracki et al.
, male. A , dorsal view; B , ventral view.

FIGURE 74.
Aulobia cardueli Skoracki et al.
, female ( A–C ). A , hypostomal apex in dorsal view; B , peritreme; C , fanlike seta p’ of leg III. Male ( D–F ). D , peritreme; E , genito-anal region. F , fan-like seta p’ of leg III.

subSubSection.paragraph:
MALE ( 2 paratypes ). Total body length 545–550.
Gnathosoma
. Infracapitulum densely punctate. Each medial branch of peritremes witch 3–4 chambers, each lateral branch witch 15–18 chambers. Movable cheliceral digit 130–135 long. Stylophore apunctate, 150–155 long.
Idiosoma
. Propodonotal shield concave on anterior margin, punctate anteriorly. Length ratio of setae vi : ve : si 1:1:1. Hysteronotal shield apunctate, bearing bases of setae d1 and e2 . Setae d1 , d2 and e2 subequal in length. Pygidial shield with indiscernible margins. Setae h2 variable in length. Genital setae g1 situated anterior to level of setae g2 . Coxal fields I–IV punctate. Setae 3c about twice as long as 3b . Legs . Fan-like setae p’ and p” with 5 tines. Setae tc’III–IV and tc”III–IV subequal in length. Lengths of setae : vi 25, ve 25, si 25, se 105–120, c1 115–135, c2 110–120, d1 20–25, d2 20–25,
e2 20
–25, f2 25, h2 variable 55–75, ag1 30–40, ag2 40, l’RIII 25, 3b 25, 3c 50–55, tc’III–IV and tc”III–IV 40–45.

Type material examined.
Carduelis psaltria (Say)
( Passeriformes : Fringillidae ): female holotype and paratypes : 7 females , 3 males , 13 nymphs;
USA , Texas , Johnson Co. , Garen Ranch ,
21 March 2004
, coll. G. Spicer.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Holotype deposited in the AMU , paratypes in the AMU and SNM .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Non-type material examined.
Carduelis carduelis (Linnaeus)
( Fringillidae ): 3 females , 2 nymphs ( AMU – SYR.93) (sec.); POLAND , Zachodniopomorskie , Weltyn, May 2001 , coll. G. Kiljan. Material deposited in the AMU .
Carduelis spinus (Linnaeus)
( Fringillidae ): 9 females , 1 male , 4 nymphs ( AVB 06–0926–010); RUSSIA , Kurish spit, 8 December 2006 , coll. A.V. Bochkov. Material deposited in the ZISP . Same host species: 6 females ( AVB 07–2010–006); KAZAKHSTAN , Ongtustik Qazaqstan, Chockpak Ornithological Station, elevation 1134 m . (42°30'45.2"N, 70°35'46.2"E), 20 October 2007 , coll. A.V. Bochkov. Material deposited in the ZISP .
Carduelis flammea (Linnaeus)
( Fringillidae ): 6 females , 4 males , 4 nymphs ( AMU –SYR.92A) (ter.); POLAND , Zachodniopomorskie , Weltyn, May 2001 , coll. G. Kiljan. Material deposited in the AMU . Same host species: 6 females , 1 male and 1 nymph ( AMU –SYR.92B) (ter.); SLOVAKIA , Bardejov, 19 January 1973 , coll. T. Weisz. Material deposited in the AMU .
Carduelis (= Serinus )
citrinella (Pallas)
( Fringillidae ): 16 females , 3 males , 1 nymph, 1 larva ( AMU –SYR.202) (sec.); POLAND , Schlesien , no other data. Material deposited in the AMU and ZISP . Host specimen deposited in the MNHW.
Carduelis flavirostris (Linnaeus)
: 7 females , 1 male , 2 nymphs ( AMU – SYR.203); POLAND , Schlesien , no other data. Material deposited in the AMU and ZISP . Host specimen deposited in the MNHW.

Hosts and habitats. In Palaearctic region this species inhabits quills of secondary and tertial feathers of five fringillid species of the genus
Carduelis
:
C. carduelis
,
C. citrinella
,
C. flamea
,
C. flavirostris
, and
C. spinus
.
Distribution. Palaearctic: Slovakia , Poland , Russia , and Kazakhstan .
